did.abstract: Papers of Hood while he was in charge of official aid to families of Confederate soldiers, with names of committee members, money paid out for relief, names of soldiers' families and corn and meat supplies held by each. Also, Civil War letters from B.R. Hood, serving in the Camp Guards and in the 24th North Carolina Regiment, and from David W. Hood, in the 67th North Carolina Regiment, describing camp life and food, the second battle of Manassas (Bull Run) and other engagements and skirmishes, and the possibility of hiring a substitute.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: John C. Hood was assistant quartermaster of Meadow Township, Johnston County, North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Papers of Hood while he was in charge of official aid to families of Confederate soldiers, with names of committee members, money paid out for relief, names of soldiers' families and corn and meat supplies held by each. Also, Civil War letters from B.R. Hood, serving in the Camp Guards and in the 24th North Carolina Regiment, and from David W. Hood, in the 67th North Carolina Regiment, describing camp life and food, the second battle of Manassas (Bull Run) and other engagements and skirmishes, and the possibility of hiring a substitute.
